thread.title: Shock Petratos defection adds to Brisbane’s woes
thread.title_full: Shock Petratos defection adds to Brisbane’s woes

title: Shock Petratos defection adds to Brisbane’s woes
text:
A-League Media Watch: Dimitri Petratos signs for Newcastle Jets, Broxham on Big Blue Staff writers with AAP, FOX SPORTS January 25, 2017 11:13am 
BRISBANE Roar have been rocked by the news of Dimitri Petratos’s defection to A-League rivals Newcastle Jets, as uncertainty remains about the futures of Jamie Maclaren and Luke DeVere. 
Petratos, who has been one of Roar’s best performers this season, is set to sign for Newcastle Jets next season, according to The Australian’s Ray Gatt. 
The Courier Mail reports Brisbane had offered Petratos a new deal to remain at the club beyond 2017. 
The 24-year-old former Sydney FC attacker joined Roar in 2013, winning the Premiership and Championship with the club in his first season. But he is now set to return to New South Wales to strengthen the Jets — who are aiming to end a long-term Finals hoodoo. 
That news will give Roar coach John Aloisi headaches, with fellow stars DeVere and Maclaren expected to leave the club in the off-season. Have heard Dimi Petratos has signed with the Jets for next season. Great signing — Ray Gatt (@Gatty54) January 24, 2017 
DeVere’s impressive performances have seen him talked up for a Socceroos recall and linked with moves back to Asia, while Maclaren has been dropped to the bench in recent weeks as speculation of his future continues. 
Maclaren has been linked with a marquee move to Western Sydney Wanderers while interest from Melbourne Victory remains. 
Fox Sports’ Mark Bosnich has said he believes Maclaren’s benching centres around his contract situation. 
“I think he’s sitting on the bench because of the contractual situation, that’s just my opinion,” he said on Fox Sports’ Sunday Shootout . 
“But the point really that Brisbane have got to decide is: are they willing to cut off their nose to spite their face? 
“Obviously the contractual situation is that because of that you are sitting him on the bench but you are costing the team. 
“We saw the team coming out in support of Jamie Maclaren this week. 
“They’ve got to make that decision. We don’t know whether that’s the club’s decision or whether it’s John Aloisi’s decision.” media_camera Luke DeVere could be set to leave Brisbane Roar. 
But there has also been links with a lucrative move to China, with former Perth Glory teammate Michael Thwaite telling Fox Sports : “I’ve heard some rumours that Chinese and Asian [clubs] are looking at a player like him.” 
Brisbane’s moves so far this season to tie down off-contract players has resulted in the re-signing of 34-year-old club captain Matt McKay and 33-year-old Danish import Thomas Kristensen. 
Club legend Thomas Broich’s contract is up at the end of the season, but he had delayed talks to allow Brisbane to focus on tying down their younger stars. 
Ahead of the Big Blue, Adam Peacock, Simon Hill and Daniel Garb tackle all the big talking points in the wonderful world of football. 
MELBOURNE CITY ANNOUNCE VALKANIS APPOINTMENT 
Melbourne City have confirmed Michael Valkanis will take charge of the side for the rest of the season. 
Having taken over on an interim basis after the shock resignation of John van’t Schip, Valkanis will have 11 more regular season games to try and propel City into a strong position heading into the Finals. 
“The next few months represent an important period for the first team,” he said after the announcement. media_camera Michael Valkanis. 
“The players and staff collectively recognise the challenge and opportunity that the second half of the season presents and I am incredibly motivated by the responsibility and the opportunity to guide the team for the remainder of the campaign.” 
SOME GOOD NEWS FOR BRISBANE ROAR 
Tommy Oar says there’s no substance to rumours he will leave Brisbane Roar during the January transfer window and expects to see out the remainder of his contract with the A-League club. 
Speculation has lingered for months that the winger would leave for either China or the Middle East, but no concrete offers have been forthcoming. 
The 25-year-old is contracted to the Roar for another year and will become a marquee player next season as part of his back-ended deal. WEL v BRI: Match Highlights 2:57 
A-League: Watch all the highlights from the match between Wellington and Brisbane. January 21st 2017 /video/video.news.com.au/Sport/Football/A-League/ WEL v BRI: Match Highlights 
Another foray into Europe is by no means out of the question - but until something comes up, the fringe Socceroo is happy to stay put in his home state. “I guess there’s been a lot of rumours around,” Oar said. 
“For me, I haven’t heard anything about any substance to those rumours. “My focus has been purely on here and performing well this season. “There’s no real reason I can see that anything would change for me in the six months to a year. 
“I really want to win something with the club this year and I think we have the quality to do that, so beyond that, I’m not looking any further.” Best of the Big Blue 1:27
